rComments: Asked people to not attend lecture to fit more people in the class, but then was poor communicating via email. Slides were generally poor (e.g. used the normal function without _any_ explanation what it is). Learned way more from Wikipedia and the book. Also, theory heavy with proofs on tests and little applied; yet it's a CE class.

J.J. is a chill professor, unfortunately, the topics he teach are EXTREMELY boring. Paying attention in lecture is nearly impossible, but thats ok, as he gives you all the information you need to pass online. I can't say ill remember much from this class, but J.J. did his best to make his class humorous when possible at least.

I love everything about JJ except his teaching. The material covered in CE 107 is very challenging but you can pass it via brute memorization. People with a B average or better going into the final did not have to take it.

I honestly don't understand why everyone finds JJ to be such a bad teacher. He literally just tells you to study the homework for the quizzes and his notes for the midterm/final and you will do fine. Most of the problems on his midterm/final are exact problems that were on the notes. I also found going to his office hours to be very helpful.

JJ is a nice guy, however, his grading and process of teaching the class is ridiculous.I had a passing grade and a good command of the material post-midterm. Then, on the final, he decided to make about 50% of the material things covered in the final week of class. As a result, my grade plummeted into the abyss.I don't recommend this course w/ JJ

He tries so hard to make this subject interesting.  But reading off of slides just isn't a good way to engage the class.  I would have done better if I'd gone to every lecture, but they were so boring.  He's very nice, but take the class with someone else if you can.
Reads off slides and has trouble engaging the class. Very smart but has trouble conveying his thoughts (limited by English). Exams are challenging but reasonably so after doing the homework.
Very hard to understand his lectures. very unorginized. extremely hard grading TA's and doesnt speak clear english. what more can you ask for?

Teacher was useless. Grades on assignments seemed completely arbitrary. I felt like I learned the material necessary to pass the class (from the textbook), but apparently I failed. Not a single test was without grievous typos. The grading system was simply not fair.
Doesn't curve

Nice guy and head of dept, but not a good lecturer. Learned concepts from book. Got good grades on quizzes, but not really sure why (I didn't ever feel like I knew what I was doing). Lecture is mostly powerpoint, and he is for sure really smart, but not skilled at relaying information. His accent was a bit hard to understand sometimes as well.

JJ is a smart guy and knows his stuff. However, he doesn't convey that information to you. If you're taking this class be careful, it starts MAD easy and about halfway through gets fairly tough. Don't attend his class, but ALWAYS be sure to attend sections, especially after week 4 or so. Get in the habit of going to section/MSI!

Never attended class. Studied everything he taught in 2 days with the help of slides and homework and solutions. Easy class, teacher cannot not be understood. Passed the final with flying colors. Logic is your friend.
Easy teacher. Probably the nicest cmpe teacher at UCSC. His powerpoints are often boring so you have to study from the book. Overall, easy class if you practice hw and his in-class examples.

Showed up half hour late to our final, which consisted of 13 questions worth at most 88 points and it was 40 percent of our grade. We had quizzes worth more points than that. Grading was BS, very little partial credit was given out. Very nice guy, but teaching style could use some work.

Wow, I never knew Professors can be such idiots. Firstly, he doesn't speak english, his lectures were very dull and he even delayed our final by nearly 45 minutes because of a copy error (complete idiot). Other than that, it was an overall easy class considering I NEVER attended lecture and I BS'ed most of the HW.

JJ is the worst professor at UCSC. The worst part about it is he is always saying how bad he is but he doesn't care because he has tenure. He tells the class he was up too late the night before and prepares the slides that morning. JJ is late to every class except when something's due. He arrives 10mins late and ends 15 mins early. Very oppressive.
No Comments

J.J. was without a doubt the worst teacher I have had yet. He speaks very quietly, and has trouble hearing questions to answer them. He changed his mind regarding the structure of the class in horrible ways. Also he chooses exceptionally difficult T.A's to grade the class. The worst part about this class is that I honestly did not learn a thing.

The class was easy but his lectures were mostly horrible. He even mentioned once in class that he prepared the lecture notes in the same morning. One good thing about his class is if you get at least a B- in his class before the final, you wont need to take the final exam. He also hands out stipends of $200 to the top four students in the class.
